events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a guardrail on the highway. Immediate assistance requested.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing initial report and keywords indicating vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims has been assigned to handle the investigation and communication with the claimant.
The claimant was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and inform them about the next steps in the process.
Requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for claim validation.
Claimant has submitted all requested documents including police report and vehicle damage photos as per guidelines.
Investigation commenced to assess the accident circumstances, verify documents, and estimate repair costs.
Investigation concluded with a full report confirming vehicle damage consistent with claimant’s account.
A settlement offer of $5,000 was proposed to cover the cost of repairs and temporary transportation expenses.
Customer responded with appreciation for the timely settlement proposal and clarity of communication.
Claim approved following positive customer feedback and comprehensive investigation results.
Payment of $5,000 issued to claimant’s bank account to cover vehicle repair and related expenses.
Claim formally closed after payment issuance and final confirmation from claimant on settlement satisfaction.
Claim documents and correspondence archived for future reference as per company retention policies.
